intro: Lastrea limaensis, commonly known as the Limaensis Lastrea, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweed and other similar plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and potential medicinal properties.
